org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.config.annotations

Annotation Type Config


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
@Target(value=METHOD)
public @interface Config
    Configuration annotation.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      boolean advanced 
      boolean allowMultiple
      If allowMultiple is false, a variable can only be set once in a given file or command-line.
      boolean compcOnly 
      boolean displayed 
      boolean greedy 
      boolean hidden 
      boolean isPath 
      boolean isRequired 
      boolean removed 

    • Element Detail

      • advanced

        public abstract boolean advanced
        Returns:
        True if this option is an advanced option.
        Default:
        false

      • hidden

        public abstract boolean hidden
        Returns:
        True if this option does not show in the help message.
        Default:
        false

      • allowMultiple

        public abstract boolean allowMultiple
        If allowMultiple is false, a variable can only be set once in a given file or command-line. Setting a variable that doesn't allow "multiple" twice will cause ConfigurationException.IllegalMultipleSet.

        Set this to true if we want to accumulate values on the option. It's usually useful for collection-based options like -compiler.external-library-path.

        Returns:
        True if the setter can be called multiple times
        Default:
        false

      • isPath

        public abstract boolean isPath
        Returns:
        True if the values are treated as paths.
        Default:
        false

      • displayed

        public abstract boolean displayed
        Returns:
        True if the option is displayed.
        Default:
        true

      • compcOnly

        public abstract boolean compcOnly
        Returns:
        True if the option is only visible to compc.
        Default:
        false

      • removed

        public abstract boolean removed
        Returns:
        True indicates that the option is no longer supported and will not have any affect.
        Default:
        false

      • greedy

        public abstract boolean greedy
        Returns:
        True if the commandline parser is in "greedy" mode.
        Default:
        false

      • isRequired

        public abstract boolean isRequired
        Returns:
        true if the option must be set.
        Default:
        false
